title: Organization
description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.
$comment:
This is an implementation of schema.org [`Organization`](https://schema.org/Organization).

An `Organization` node is analogous, and structurally similar to:
- Crossref Organization element [`<crossref:organization>`](https://data.crossref.org/reports/help/schema_doc/4.4.0/relations_xsd.html#http___www.crossref.org_relations.xsd_organization)
- JATS XML [`<institution-wrap>`](https://jats.nlm.nih.gov/archiving/tag-library/1.1/element/institution-wrap.html)
- Open Document [`<text:organizations>`](http://docs.oasis-open.org/office/v1.2/os/OpenDocument-v1.2-os-part1.html#__RefHeading__1419060_253892949) and [`<text:institutions>`](http://docs.oasis-open.org/office/v1.2/os/OpenDocument-v1.2-os-part1.html#__RefHeading__1418948_253892949)

type.$comment: This is a special property analogous to JSON-LD's `@type` keyword.

id.$comment: This is a special property analogous to JSON-LD's `@id` keyword.

identifiers.description: Any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing.
identifiers.$comment:
Some identifiers have specific properties e.g the `issn` property for
the `Periodical` type. These should be used in preference to this
property which is intended for identifiers that do not yet have a
specific property. Identifiers can be represented as strings, but
using a `PropertyValue` will usually be better because it allows
for `propertyID` (i.e. the type of identifier).

brands.description: Brands that the organization is connected with.

departments.description: Departments within the organization. For example, Department of Computer Science, Research & Development etc.

funders.description: Organization(s) or person(s) funding the organization.

legalName.description: The official name of the organization, e.g. the registered company name.

logo.$comment:
This is a singleton property because, at any one time, an organization
will usually only have one logo.

members.description: Person(s) or organization(s) who are members of this organization.

parentOrganization.description: Entity that the Organization is a part of. For example, parentOrganization to a department is a university.
